column4: when i try to install matlab, terminal says, "bash: ./install: /bin/sh: bad interpreter: Permission denied"
Change the first line of the install file from #!/bin/sh to #!/bin/bash
the file is in the cdrom.. should i copy it to the system and then install?
I think that would be the best thing to do.
!dash | vignesh triggered it to tell you that.
matlab comes in 3 cds.. should i copy all the three into the system??
er, alternatively you could temporarily symlink /bin/sh to /bin/bash instead of copying all that data to your harddrive
can u tel me in detaill plz..
sure.  sudo ln -si /bin/bash /bin/sh        it should ask for confirmation before doing it
even now it says the same error.. :)
hey thanks a lot.. i copied and pasted and it worked.. :)
